Motto_trans: (Latin, "We dare to defend our rights" or "We Dare Maintain Our Rights")
(Latin, "Nothing without Providence" or "Nothing without the Deity")

State_motto: Ua Mau ke Ea o ka ‘Āina i ka Pono
Motto_trans: (Hawaiian, "The life of the land is perpetuated in righteousness")

State_motto: Our liberties we prize and our rights we will maintain
United we stand, divided we fall; Deo gratiam habeamus
Motto_trans: (Latin, "Let us be grateful to God"; adopted in 2002)

State_motto: Fatti maschi, parole femmine / Scuto bonae voluntatis coronasti nos / crescite et multiplicamini
Motto_trans: (Italian, "Strong deeds, gentle words") / (Latin "By the shield of your good will you have crowned us") / (Latin "grow and multiply")

State_motto: Ense petit placidam sub libertate quietem
Motto_trans: (Latin, "By the sword we seek peace, but peace only under liberty")

State_motto: Si quaeris peninsulam amoenam circumspice / Tuebor
Motto_trans: (Latin, "If you seek a pleasant peninsula, look about you") / (Latin, "I will defend")

State_motto: L'étoile du Nord (Official state motto) / Quae sursum volo videre (Territorial motto never repealed)
Motto_trans: (French, "The star of the North") / (Latin, "I long to see what is beyond")
(Latin, "The Welfare of the People is the Highest Law")

State_motto: Liberty and union, now and forever, one and inseparable / Strength from the soil
Motto_trans: Daniel Webster quote used on the Great Seal / motto used on the Coat of Arms

State_motto: With God, all things are possible / Imperium in imperio
The Union, and Alis volat propriis
Dum spiro spero / animis opibusque parati
Motto_trans: (Latin, "While I breathe, I hope" / "prepared in minds and resources")

State_motto: Freedom and Unity and Stella quarta decima fulgeat
Equal Rights and Cedant arma togae.
